intro: Lasiocorys arabica, commonly known as the Arabian coffee plant, is a flowering shrub native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that contain seeds used for coffee production. It thrives in arid to semi-arid environments and requires well-drained soil. Due to habitat loss and climate change, it is considered a vulnerable species.
